message_1: Find all entire functions $f(z)$ such that $|f(z)| \leq |z|^{2022}$ for all $z \in \mathbb{C}$.
message_2:
We will use the Cauchy integral formula to solve this problem. The Cauchy integral formula states that for a holomorphic function $f$ defined on a simply connected domain $D$ containing a closed disk $C$ and its interior, we have

$$f^{(n)}(a) = \frac{n!}{2\pi i} \oint_C \frac{f(z)}{(z-a)^{n+1}} dz$$

for any $a \in D$ and any non-negative integer $n$. In particular, we have

$$f^{(n)}(0) = \frac{n!}{2\pi i} \oint_C \frac{f(z)}{z^{n+1}} dz$$

for any non-negative integer $n$.

Now, let $C$ be the circle centered at the origin with radius $R > 0$. Then, we have

$$|f^{(n)}(0)| = \left|\frac{n!}{2\pi i} \oint_C \frac{f(z)}{z^{n+1}} dz\right| \leq \frac{n!}{2\pi} \oint_C \frac{|f(z)|}{|z|^{n+1}} |dz| \leq \frac{n!}{2\pi} \oint_C \frac{|z|^{2022}}{|z|^{n+1}} |dz|$$

since $|f(z)| \leq |z|^{2022}$ for all $z \in \mathbb{C}$. We get

$$|f^{(n)}(0)| \leq \frac{n!}{2\pi} \oint_C R^{2022-n} |dz| = \frac{n!}{2\pi} \cdot R^{2022-n} \cdot 2\pi R = n!R^{2022-n}$$

Now, let $R \to \infty$. We have

$$|f^{(n)}(0)| \leq \lim_{R \to \infty} n!R^{2022-n} = 0$$

for all $n \geq 2023$. This implies that $f^{(n)}(0) = 0$ for all $n \geq 2023$. Since $f$ is entire, its Taylor series converges to $f$ on the entire complex plane, so we have

$$f(z) = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{f^{(n)}(0)}{n!} z^n = \sum_{n=0}^{2022} \frac{f^{(n)}(0)}{n!} z^n$$

Thus, $f(z)$ is a polynomial of degree at most 2022. Conversely, any polynomial of degree at most 2022 satisfies the given condition, since $|f(z)| \leq |z|^{2022}$ for all $z \in \mathbb{C}$ if $f$ is a polynomial of degree at most 2022.

Therefore, the entire functions $f(z)$ satisfying the given condition are precisely the polynomials of degree at most 2022.
